turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I need to file an insurance claim. My car was damaged in an accident yesterday.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I am sorry to hear about the accident. I can certainly help you with your claim. To get started, could you please provide your policy number and a brief description of what happened?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, my policy number is ABC123XYZ. The other driver ran a red light and hit me. I have pictures of the damage and the other driver's insurance info.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. Please upload the pictures and the other driver's information. I will also need a police report if one was filed. Please allow for a few minutes for the upload. Once that is done, I will start an investigation and be in touch to discuss the next steps. Please note, the investigation could take up to 5 business days. But, I will keep you informed. Also, do you have any questions for me?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Five business days? That seems excessive. What if my car is totaled and I need a rental immediately? Can I get reimbursed for that, and how long will it take to get the reimbursement if so?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. If your vehicle is deemed a total loss, we can certainly arrange for a rental car. Rental coverage is included in your policy, subject to your deductible. Regarding reimbursement time, it can vary. Generally, it takes 7-10 business days after the claim is approved and all necessary documentation, like rental agreements and receipts, are received. I am currently uploading the documentation. Would you like me to provide a list of approved rental companies in the area?
